solution_line_template: In class A, there are {percent_in_class_a} * {total_students} = <<{percent_in_class_a}*{total_students}={class_a_students}>>{class_a_students} students.

In class B, the number of students is less by {class_b_difference}, which means class B has {class_a_students} - {class_b_difference} = <<{class_a_students}-{class_b_difference}={class_b_students}>>{class_b_students} students.
That means {total_students} - {class_a_students} - {class_b_students} = <<{total_students}-{class_a_students}-{class_b_students}={class_c_students}>>{class_c_students} students are in class C.
